meanings.definition: To insert or introduce between other elements
meanings.sent1: I had to interpolate additional data points to complete the graph.
meanings.sent2: The software can interpolate missing values based on the existing data.
meanings.sent3: Trying to interpolate a joke into a serious conversation can be awkward.
meanings.sent4: She interpolated her personal experiences into the historical narrative.
meanings.sent5: The artist's ability to interpolate emotions into their paintings is truly remarkable.

meanings.definition: To estimate a value within known values
meanings.sent1: You can interpolate the missing temperature readings using this formula.
meanings.sent2: The scientist used the data points to interpolate the population size.
meanings.sent3: It's like trying to interpolate the number of jellybeans in a jar without counting.
meanings.sent4: She could interpolate the mood of the room just by observing people's expressions.
meanings.sent5: The detective was able to interpolate the time of the crime based on the evidence.

meanings.definition: To alter or corrupt (a text) by inserting new or foreign matter
meanings.sent1: The forger tried to interpolate fake signatures into the document.
meanings.sent2: It is unethical to interpolate false information into a research paper.
meanings.sent3: He thought he could interpolate his own ideas into the original text.
meanings.sent4: The hacker attempted to interpolate malicious code into the system.
meanings.sent5: The author refused to let anyone interpolate her novel with additional chapters.
